thread.title: Lunar events inspire scenic moon flights
thread.title_full: Lunar events inspire scenic moon flights

title: Lunar events inspire scenic moon flights
text:
Homicide probe launched after body found in Auckland house ... more soon Lunar events inspire scenic moon flights Last updated 05:00, September 24 2015 PHIL WALTER/GETTY IMAGES 
Spring Airlines, China's budget airline, will offer around 100 scenic flights from September 26 to 28. 
With three important lunar events on this month's calendar, a Chinese airline is offering scenic 'moon-viewing' flights. 
A supermoon, total lunar eclipse (also called blood moon) and Asia's Mid-Autumn Festival, also known as the Moon Festival, are all set to occur in September. 
The Moon Festival falls on the 15th day of the eighth lunar month. In China and parts of Asia it's believed to be the day with the brightest moon of the year. 
And on September 27, for the first time in more than 30 years, a supermoon and a total lunar eclipse will be visible in the Northern hemisphere on the same day. 
To mark the occasion, airlines in China are introducing a range of "moon-viewing flights." 
READ ALSO: * Blood moons coincide with holy days 
Spring Airlines , China's budget airline, will offer around 100 scenic flights from September 26 to 28. 
Yi Mao, the airline's head of marketing, told CNN that homesickness spiked during festivals and that the Moon festival was "an important festival for the Chinese." 
"It's a day of reunions for families and friends in China, who will come together to eat mooncakes under the full moon. Ad Feedback 
"We hope the moon-viewing flights will take care of the emotional needs of our customers who are still on the road during the festival." 
Even if the weather's cloudy on the ground, there will be an unobstructed view once the plane climbs above the clouds. 
More than 100 of Spring Airlines' seats dedicated to the festival have been sold so far. 
According to NASA , the eclipse will only be visible in the Americas, Europe, Africa, parts of West Asia and the eastern Pacific. - Stuff
